sen.e: MINAMOTO no Kanetsuna (year of birth not known - June 20, 1180) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived in the end of Heian Period.

sen.e: He had brothers including Muneyori, Masamitsu, Nakatoki, MINAMOTO no Masatsuna, Mitsukata and Gishumonin Tango.

sen.j: 当初平家方は、乱の首謀者が頼政であることを把握しておらず、以仁王追捕のために招集した検非違使の中に兼綱を含めるという愚を犯している。
sen.e: At first, the Taira family side did not know that the key plotter of the turmoil was Yorimasa, and made a fool of themselves to include Kanetsuna in kebiishi assembled to arrest Mochihitoo.

sen.e: In the battle of Uji Byodo-in, they were outnumbered and defeated and Kanetsuna died bravely in the Uji Byodo-in Temple (Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture) guarding Yorimasa.

sen.e: The Okochi clan, from which Nobutsuna MATSUDAIRA, who was called Matsudaira Izu no Kami, came out, was Kanetsuna's descendant who escaped to Okochi, Nukata District in Mikawa Province (Aza Okochi, Ohira-cho, Okazaki City, Aichi Prefecture; near to Okazaki Interchange of the Tokyo-Nagoya Expressway).
